content.question: A student obtains a mixture of the chlorides of two unknown metals, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>. The percent by mass of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></math> and the percent by mass of <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math> in the mixture is known. Which of the following additional information is most helpful in calculating the mole percent of <math alttext="X C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>XCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and of <math alttext="Z C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ZCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> in the mixture?

choices.label: The number of isotopes of <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></math>

The molar masses of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>

The density of either <math alttext="X C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>XCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> or <math alttext="Z C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>ZCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
The percent by mass of <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></math> in the mixture

content.answer: The molar masses of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>

skill.text: 5.A: Identify quantities needed to solve a problem from given information (e.g., text, mathematical expressions, graphs, or tables).
